definition: erhua variant of 打盹[da3 dun3]
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: He dozed off in the armchair.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在扶手椅里打盹儿。

sentences.english: If you doze, it eats you up.
sentences.chinese: 你一打盹儿，它就会吃了你。

sentences.english: She went upstairs to take a nap after finishing with the still.
sentences.chinese: 后来她摆弄完了蒸馏机就上楼去打盹儿。

sentences.english: A government official was caught taking a nano nap during a conference.
sentences.chinese: 一名政府官员被发现在开会时打盹儿。

sentences.english: It was necessary, therefore, to invent instruments that neither slumbered nor slept.
sentences.chinese: 因此，有必要发明一种仪器，既不打盹儿，也不睡觉。

sentences.english: Britty (Kellys baby) was taking a nap, stretched out along the back seat.
sentences.chinese: 布瑞蒂正躺在车后座打盹儿。

sentences.english: He was found to huddle by his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他的老板发现他在上班时打盹儿。

sentences.english: Meantime the Rat, warm and comfortable, dozed by his fireside.
sentences.chinese: 这当儿，河鼠正暖和舒服地坐在炉边打盹儿。

definition: to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
to relax with one's eyes closed
